title: UK passport photo checker shows bias against dark-skinned women
description: Website flagged twice as many dark-skinned women's photos as those from light-skinned men in BBC test.

title: The friends who drove a bus behind the Iron Curtain
description: The men and women who drove across Europe in a double-decker bus that was older than them.

title: Giant hogweed: One man's battle against 'toxic invader'
description: Oskars has spent eight years trying to stop an invasive toxic weed surrounding his home in Latvia.

title: Are wildfires the end of the Californian dream?
description: As unprecedented wildfires rage across the Golden State, Californians have been bearing the brunt.

title: Hathras case: A fatal assault, a cremation and no goodbye
description: The family of an Indian woman who died after an alleged gang rape by upper-caste men are in torment.

title: Men's 10,000m and women's 5,000m world records smashed in Valencia
description: Uganda's Joshua Cheptegei smashes the men's 10,000m world record as Ethiopia's Letesenbet Gidey breaks that of the women's 5,000m in Valencia.

title: Gymnasts cannot heal if investigation is slow, says three-time Olympic champion Raisman
description: US triple Olympic champion Aly Raisman says gymnasts will not be able to "heal" if an investigation into allegations of mistreatment of British Gymnastics takes a long time.

title: Girls Takeover: Teen becomes Finland's PM for the day
description: Aava Murto is taking over for the day as part of a campaign for girls' digital rights.

title: Nicola Sturgeon 'forgot' about meeting with Alex Salmond aide
description: The first minister's evidence to an inquiry into her government's handling of complaints against Mr Salmond is published.

title: Greece Golden Dawn: Neo-Nazi leaders guilty of running crime gang
description: After a five-year trial in Greece, judges rule that Golden Dawn is a criminal organisation.

title: Children not able to give 'proper' consent to puberty blockers, court told
description: The UK's only children's NHS gender clinic is facing a legal challenge at London's High Court.

title: Injured England lock Lawes to miss autumn matches
description: Northampton lock Courtney Lawes will miss England's autumn schedule with an ankle injury.

title: Greene King to close dozens of pubs and cut 800 jobs
description: The pub giant blames tighter coronavirus restrictions and the winding down of the furlough scheme.

title: Covid: PM challenged to publish evidence behind 10pm pub closing time
description: Labour's Sir Keir Starmer says the early closing time in England must be reviewed if it isn't justified.

title: Six Nations: 2021 tournament could be delayed to allow crowds
description: The 2021 Six Nations could be delayed in an attempt to ensure matches are played in front of crowds.

title: French Open 2020: Petra Kvitova beats Laura Siegemund to reach semi-finals
description: Petra Kvitova reaches the French Open semi-finals without dropping a set after victory over Laura Siegemund.

title: Skywatchers set for Draconid meteor shower
description: The meteor shower reaches its peak this week, and will be visible in UK skies, weather permitting.

title: Sarah Forbes Bonetta: Portrait of Queen Victoria's goddaughter on show
description: English Heritage said it would feature portraits of "overlooked" black figures connected with its sites.

title: Doubt cast on cause of Giro crash which left rider with suspected broken back
description: Organisers cast doubt over the cause of a crash in which Luca Wackermann was injured at the Giro d'Italia.

title: Toothless dinosaur with just two fingers discovered
description: Several complete skeletons of the unusual two-fingered dinosaurs were unearthed in the Gobi Desert.

title: Sale-Worcester off after eight more Covid-19 cases
description: Sale Sharks' rearranged Premiership match with Worcester Warriors on Wednesday is called off.

title: Covid in Scotland: Nicola Sturgeon to announce new restrictions
description: Much tighter restrictions are likely to be imposed on pubs in areas with higher levels of the virus.

title: Coronavirus: Health experts join global anti-lockdown movement
description: Scientists warn of the "devastating" effect of Covid-19 policies, calling for a return to normal for healthy.

title: Scientists win historic Nobel chemistry prize for 'genetic scissors'
description: Two women have shared the prize for the first time, winning for their work on genome editing.

title: Big Tech: Between a rock and a hard place
description: Whoever wins the US elections, Big Tech is about to get clobbered.

title: September was world's 'hottest on record'
description: Scientists say it is a clear indication of temperatures rising because of emissions from our society.

title: How non-league loan, a cup of tea and Ancelotti advice helped Calvert-Lewin into England squad
description: Dominic Calvert-Lewin has enjoyed a blistering start to the season, scoring six goals in four league games to help Everton achieve a perfect start.

title: Black History Month: Images of strength and beauty
description: Black people from all sectors of British life feature in an exhibition for Black History Month.

title: Monty Don on why we should put our phones down and go outside
description: The Gardeners' World host says we are becoming "divorced from nature" and urges us to go outside.

title: Local lockdown UK: Do city-wide curbs work? It's not clear
description: One in four people in the UK is currently subject to local interventions to prevent the spread of Covid.

title: 'Cities as friendly to strangers as towns and villages'
description: Researchers test reactions to strangers in need of assistance - with Nottingham the most helpful.

title: Unexplained Wealth Orders: Suspected money launderer gives up £10m of property
description: A suspected money launderer gives up 45 properties after investigators used an Unexplained Wealth Order.

title: Tech tales of love, sex and online abuse in India
description: A crowd-sourced Instagram art project documents women's experiences of online abuse.
